result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale Gernon Bolton Jr

defendant.name: Bolton, Dale Gernon, Jr
defendant.address: 913 N Spring St # 406, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 090697,
Payable Number: 245469,
Receipt Number: 22R 014438,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:53 PM Defendant Dale Gernon Bolton Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler (Not eligible) appeared by video for Dale Gernon Bolton Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within/waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000.00 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobrietyand shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. . Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
